easy.prompt: Interpret the subscription: Disp. supp. rect. no. xii.
easy.solution: 'Disp.' means dispense; 'supp. rect.' means rectal suppositories; 'no. xii' means twelve.

easy.prompt: Interpret the signa: ii gtt each eye q4h p.r.n. pain.
easy.solution: 'ii gtt' means two drops; 'each eye' implies both eyes; 'q4h' is every 4 hours; 'p.r.n. pain' is as needed for pain.
answerText: Instill 2 drops in each eye every 4 hours as needed for pain
Place two drops in each eye every four hours as needed for pain

easy.prompt: Interpret the signa: 1 tbsp p.o. q6h.
easy.solution: '1 tbsp' is one tablespoon; 'p.o.' means by mouth; 'q6h' is every 6 hours.
answerText: Take 1 tablespoon by mouth every 6 hours
One tablespoon orally every six hours

easy.prompt: Interpret the signa: Apply am & pm p.r.n. itching.
easy.solution: 'am' and 'pm' indicate morning and evening; 'p.r.n.' means as needed; the condition is itching.
answerText: Apply in the morning and evening as needed for itching
Apply morning and evening if needed for itching

easy.prompt: Interpret the signa: 1–2 tabs p.o. q4–6h u.d.
easy.solution: '1–2 tabs' means one or two tablets; 'p.o.' is by mouth; 'q4–6h' is every 4–6 hours; 'u.d.' means as directed (ut dictum).
answerText: Take 1 to 2 tablets by mouth every 4 to 6 hours as directed
Take one or two tablets orally every four to six hours as directed

hard.prompt: Translate the medication order: AMBIEN 10 mg p.o. q.h.s. × 5 d.
hard.solution: 'p.o.' is by mouth; 'q.h.s.' means each night at bedtime; '× 5 d' indicates for five days.
answerText: Take 10 mg Ambien by mouth at bedtime for 5 days
Administer 10 mg Ambien orally at bedtime for five days

hard.prompt: Translate: Administer prochlorperazine 10 mg IM q3h p.r.n. N&V.
hard.solution: 'IM' means intramuscularly; 'q3h' is every 3 hours; 'p.r.n.' is as needed; 'N&V' stands for nausea and vomiting.
answerText: Administer 10 mg prochlorperazine intramuscularly every 3 hours as needed for nausea and vomiting

hard.prompt: Translate: 1000 mL D5W q8h IV with 20 mEq KCl to every 3rd container.
hard.solution: D5W denotes 5% dextrose in water; q8h is every 8 hours; KCl is potassium chloride; the instruction indicates to add it to every third container.
answerText: Infuse 1000 mL of D5W every 8 hours intravenously and add 20 mEq potassium chloride to every third container

hard.prompt: Translate: Cefazolin sodium 1 g IM 30 min prior to procedure.
hard.solution: 'IM' means intramuscular; '1 g' is the dose; '30 min prior' is 30 minutes before the procedure.
answerText: Administer 1 g cefazolin sodium intramuscularly 30 minutes before the procedure

hard.prompt: Translate: Mesalamine 1.2 g p.o. q.d. c food.
hard.solution: 'p.o.' means by mouth; 'q.d.' is once daily; 'c food' is with food.
answerText: Take 1.2 g mesalamine by mouth once daily with food
